DOC.brief_summary: Fifty healthy , young participant ( 10 male , 40 female ) complete two 3-hour study session least five day apart . The first session baseline . The sleep intervention take place night prior Session 2 , amount time bed manipulate 60-130 % individual 's habitual sleep time . Within session , subjective ( Stanford Sleepiness Scale , SSS ) objective ( Psychomotor Vigilance Test , PVT ) alertness measure . During middle session , 40-minute ad libitum meal opportunity allow participant eat eight different food item . Food healthfulness , caloric density , distribution number calorie measure compare alertness level .
DOC.brief_title: Impaired Vigilance , Its Effects Cognition Behavior
DOC.criteria: Age : 1845 year BMI : 2029 kg/mÂ² Eat breakfast least 5 day per week Wake time occur 5 & 10AM least 5 day per week Time bed sleep 5 & 10 hour least 5 day per week Dietary restriction prohibit select one food choice offer study ( e.g. , gluten allergy , diabetes , vegan diet , dairy avoidance , allergy respective food choice available ) , currently calorierestricted diet , currently weight less 20 % high weight within last three year . Participation shift work within 7 night experiment Diagnosed severe sleep apnea syndrome , narcolepsy chronic insomnia Diagnosed eat disorder Active serious health condition Regularly take vigilancerelated medication ( e.g. , ADHD prescribe medication ) Typically consume 600 mg coffee 10 cigarette per day
